thread.title: Scarlett Moffatt's parents Betty and Mark 'dropped from Gogglebox' | Metro News
thread.title_full: Scarlett Moffatt's parents Betty and Mark 'dropped from Gogglebox' | Metro News

author: Sarah Deen For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Scarlett Moffatt's parents Betty and Mark 'dropped from Gogglebox' | Metro News
text:
Sarah Deen for Metro.co.uk Saturday 18 Feb 2017 11:53 pm Scarlett’s ‘rents Betty and Mark have been dropped from the new series (Picture: Channel 4) 
Scarlett Moffatt’s parents have been ‘cut’ from Gogglebox. Sponsored 13 realities of going wedding dress shopping 
Betty and Mark Moffatt won’t appear in the next series because Scarlett is too much of a star in her own right, according to the Sunday People . 
She and her parents were fan favourites as they gave commentary on various TV shows from their sofa in Durham. 
The 26-year-old has become hugely popular off the back of the Channel 4 series, going on to win I’m A Celebrity…Get Me Out Of Here! last year. 
But ahead of the show’s return on Friday, a Channel 4 spokeswoman confirmed told the Sunday People: ‘The Moffatt family will not be appearing in this series.’ A post shared by Scarlett Moffatt (@scarlett_moffatt) on Dec 28, 2016 at 5:06am PST 
According to a TV insider, Channel 4 bosses aren’t convinced Betty and Mark will be as popular without their daughter. 
They said: ‘The whole premise of Gogglebx is normal people commenting on the TV. Scarlett is now a celebrity in her own right so it made sense she wouldn’t continue. A post shared by Scarlett Moffatt (@scarlett_moffatt) on Feb 6, 2017 at 3:24pm PST 
‘She and her parents came as a package. It wouldn’t work so well without all three of them.’ 
The family didn’t appear during the last series as it clashed with Scarlett’s appearance on I’m A Celeb. Scarlett’s star has risen (Picture: Joe Maher/Getty Images) 
Since winning being crowned queen of the jungle, Scarlett has gone on to join the team on Ant and Dec’s Saturday Night Takeaway. Jungle Queen and kebab connoisseur @ScarlettMoffatt , welcome to the #Takeaway family! #ReasonsToWatchTakeaway pic.twitter.com/dBB2eNgNXa 
She’s also set to host a revamped version of 90s dating show Streetmate . 
Metro.co.uk has contacted Channel 4 for comment. 
We think this is a dazzling story and so do you! Like Metro Entertainment on Facebook for more of this on your news feed.
